summary: This is an email chain from June 2019 forwarding a draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein. The sender critiques the draft as insufficient and needing to 'speak more,' while the original sender, an Assistant United States Attorney, explains the draft keeps facts sparse to protect victims and preserve investigative advantages.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The original sender of the forwarded email who attached a draft indictment and explained the strategy of keeping facts sparse to protect victims and the investigation.

events.title: Draft Indictment Prepared
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney circulates a draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein for review.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was being circulated among prosecutors in June 2019.
The draft indictment was intentionally written with sparse facts to protect victims and to avoid publicizing details that could help vet future witnesses.
The initial reviewer of the draft found it insufficient and believed it needed to 'speak more,' indicating internal debate about the charging strategy.
